alert.note: Alert for Caledonia; Essex; Orange; Orleans; Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 01 at 12:44PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A snow squall will impact portions of Lamoille, northeastern Orange, Caledonia, Orleans, Essex, east central Chittenden, northeastern Washington and southeastern Franklin Counties through 130 PM EST... At 1243 PM EST, A snow squall was reported along a line extending from near Newport City to Underhill. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds 25 mph or greater, visibility less than a quarter mile, and snow accumulation up to 1 inch per hour. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds may blow around unsecured objects. Very low visibility will pose a hazard to motorists. Accumulating snow will make travel difficult. Locations impacted include... St. Johnsbury, Newport City, Island Pond, Lyndon, Morrisville, Orleans, Derby Center, Charleston, Newport Town, Cambridge, Glover, Albany, Burke, Worcester, Marshfield, Newark, Cabot Village, Brownington Village, West Burke Village and Waterville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 91 between mile markers 111 and 116, near mile marker 118, near mile marker 120, and between mile markers 123 and 177. Interstate 93 between mile markers 1 and 11.
info.instruction: Rapid visibility reduction and potentially icy roads are likely to produce hazardous driving conditions. travel is not advised during this snow squall. If you are traveling and encounter adverse winter driving conditions, reduce speed and make sure headlights are on to increase the visibility of your vehicle to those around you.
